title: Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore: Park Home
body: Sand and Solitude  Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore hugs 15 miles of the southern shore of Lake Michigan and has much to offer. Whether you enjoy scouting for rare species of birds or flying kites on the sandy beach, the national lakeshore's 15,000 acres will continually enchant you.Â  Hikers will enjoy 50 miles of trails over rugged dunes, mysterious wetlands, sunny prairies, meandering rivers and peaceful forests.              Free Symphony Concert at West Beach   Celebrate National Park Service's 100th Anniversary at a FREE concert featuring the Northwest Indiana Symphony!          Beach Shuttle - Catch a free ride!   Free shuttle from Miller Train Station to the beach            Events Calendar   Upcoming special events and activities        Museum 50th Anniversary Exhibits   Museum 50th Anniversary Exhibits              Get Out and Help Us Celebrate 50   A year of celebrations!
